I don’t see how giving you a better example is being a dick, if there are way simpler of doing things wouldn’t you want to know them? I would think NOT posting that would be a dick.
[/quote] it is dicky… just like if you posted something you worked hard on, then all of a sudden i post something better

would you be offended?

i love it when the more experienced than i (programming) takes my code and tweaks it making it more efficient. it’s too bad that you don’t feel the same way.[/quote]
Agreed, although sometimes it can be a bit annoying wen they scrunch as much possible into 1 line, so its almost not readable enough to learn from. (not talking about anything posted here)

item.description:
@mironic wrote:

[quote=“Muroth, post:6, topic:409123”][code]
import java.util.Date;
import java.text.DateFormat;
import java.text.SimpleDateFormat;

private String getDateTime() {
    DateFormat dateFormat = new SimpleDateFormat("yyyy/MM/dd HH:mm:ss");
    Date date = new Date();
    return dateFormat.format(date);
}

[/code][/quote]
dont be a dick, posting a shorter version just means you looked at mine and made it shorter.

        Date date = new Date();
        return dateFormat.format(date);

item.source: Simple program that grabs the date and time

item.title: Simple program that grabs the date and time
item.dc:creator: @mironic mironic
item.description:
@mironic wrote:

easy… as 1 2 3… just putting it out there… because i can.

i dont want anyone flaming me saying “this is noob java” because i know that… i was bored… so i put this together

4 files

InitialFrame1 InitialFrame1$InitialPanel Null (does nothing you can delete it...) run.bat
if anyone wants to source code just ask… its easy java… so i dont think anyone would want it…

also the source

[code]import javax.swing.;
import java.awt.;
import java.io.;
import java.util.;

public class InitialFrame1 extends JFrame
{
public InitialFrame1()
{
setSize(200, 100);
setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
Container pane = getContentPane();
FlowLayout flo = new FlowLayout();
pane.setLayout(flo);
InitialPanel Date = new InitialPanel();
pane.add(Date);
setContentPane(Date);
InitialPanel Time = new InitialPanel();
pane.add(Time);
setContentPane(Time);
setVisible(true);
InitialPanel Text = new InitialPanel();
pane.add(Text);
setContentPane(Text);
setVisible(true);

    }

public static void main (String[] arguments)
{
InitialFrame1 a1 = new InitialFrame1();
}

public class InitialPanel extends JPanel
{
public InitialPanel()
{
String Current_Date = getDate();
JLabel Date = new JLabel(Current_Date);
Date.setForeground(Color.blue);
add(Date);
String Current_Time = getTime();
JLabel Time = new JLabel(Current_Time);
Time.setForeground(Color.blue);
add(Time);
String Current_Text = getText();
JLabel Text = new JLabel(Current_Text);
Text.setForeground(Color.red);
add(Text);

}  

String getDate()

{
String Date;
// get current Date
Calendar now = Calendar.getInstance();
int month = now.get(Calendar.MONTH) + 1;
int day = now.get(Calendar.DAY_OF_MONTH);
int year = now.get(Calendar.YEAR);

Date = month + "/" + day + "/" + year;
return Date;

}

String getTime()

{
String Time;
// get current Time
Calendar now = Calendar.getInstance();
int hour = now.get(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY);
int minute = now.get(Calendar.MINUTE);
int second = now.get(Calendar.SECOND);

Time = hour + ":" + minute + ":" + second;
return Time;

}

String getText()

{
String Text;
// Just some text here at the bottom
Text = “made By Mironic”;
return Text;
}
}
}[/code]

Read full topic
